BasicDescription.Title: World Briefing
BasicDescription.Synopsis: World news and despatches.

BasicDescription.Title: Sports Roundup
BasicDescription.Synopsis: Sports Roundup brings you sports news, stories and results from all around the world. The team of global correspondents collect stories, scores and interviews.

BasicDescription.Title: World News
BasicDescription.Synopsis: The latest news updates from around the world.

BasicDescription.Title: Newshour
BasicDescription.Synopsis: News, comment and analysis from around the world. Newshour brings you the latest live reports on events all over the globe.

BasicDescription.Title: Assignment
BasicDescription.Synopsis: Assignment delves behind the headlines to find out how news events affect people's lives. Whatever the subject, wherever the location, the stories are of real human interest.

BasicDescription.Title: The World Today
BasicDescription.Synopsis: News and analysis from around the world.

BasicDescription.Title: Wright Round The World
BasicDescription.Synopsis: Steve Wright and the team play listeners' requests and dedications. Send an email to be read out live on air to ws.pop@bbc.co.uk

BasicDescription.Title: Westway Omnibus
BasicDescription.Synopsis: Catch up on the week's events in the omnibus edition of BBC World Service's daily drama series.

BasicDescription.Title: World Business Report
BasicDescription.Synopsis: Analysis of the key business issues of the day, with up-to-date information on key currency rates, commodity prices and stock market indices.

BasicDescription.Title: The New Europe
BasicDescription.Synopsis: The continent whose internal power struggles caused two world wars is forging new structures and alliances. The New Europe addresses the most significant issues now facing Europe.

BasicDescription.Title: Talking Point
BasicDescription.Synopsis: Topical news stories discussed and debated. Listeners around the world can take part in the live multi-media programme by emailing: talkingpoint@bbc.co.uk

BasicDescription.Title: Off The Shelf
BasicDescription.Synopsis: Discovering Home: By Binyavanga Wainaina from Kenya, who is the winner of this year's Caine Prize for African Writing. Broadcast in two parts.

BasicDescription.Title: Meridian Masterpiece
BasicDescription.Synopsis: Over the next three weeks Brian Sibley investigates the art of portrait painting and how the idea of the portrait has been recast in three famous works by Pablo Picasso, Edward Munch and Andy Warhol.

BasicDescription.Title: Charlie Gillett
BasicDescription.Synopsis: From township jive to tuva throatsinging, Charlie Gillett unearths wonderfully stimulating sounds from around the globe in this selection of World Music tracks.

BasicDescription.Title: One Planet
BasicDescription.Synopsis: Lie Of The Land: Susie Emmett investigates the commercial, social and political pressures that influence land use.

BasicDescription.Title: Heritage
BasicDescription.Synopsis: Malcolm Billings explores the world of archaeology and conservation. He goes to Havana, where the Cuban authorities struggle with the restoration of buildings that date back to the 16th century.

BasicDescription.Title: British News
BasicDescription.Synopsis: The latest news and comment from Britain.

BasicDescription.Title: Outlook
BasicDescription.Synopsis: The World Service's daily magazine programme.

BasicDescription.Title: Write On
BasicDescription.Synopsis: Penny Vine with listeners' questions and inquiries about the BBC World Service programmes, which are answered with the help of programme makers. Email: writeon@bbc.co.uk

BasicDescription.Title: Arts In Action
BasicDescription.Synopsis: Ed Butler presents the weekly arts news magazine, reporting on the most significant international events.

BasicDescription.Title: Jazzmatazz
BasicDescription.Synopsis: Alyn Shipton with jazz reviews, requests and interviews.

BasicDescription.Title: Science In Action
BasicDescription.Synopsis: From outer space to the atom's inner workings, news from the fascinating worlds of science and technology.

BasicDescription.Title: I Have A Right
BasicDescription.Synopsis: Part 3. A look at how rights have been affected in countries targeted by the US since September 11th, and the positive effects of peace and rights protection in countries affected by the tragedy.

BasicDescription.Title: Analysis
BasicDescription.Synopsis: The programme that examines topical aspects of current international issues.

BasicDescription.Title: Europe Today
BasicDescription.Synopsis: All the latest news, analysis and comment, from around Europe.

BasicDescription.Title: World News
BasicDescription.Synopsis: The latest news updates from around the world.

BasicDescription.Title: Meridian Masterpiece
BasicDescription.Synopsis: Over the next three weeks Brian Sibley investigates the art of portrait painting and how the idea of the portrait has been recast in three famous works by Pablo Picasso, Edward Munch and Andy Warhol.

BasicDescription.Title: Charlie Gillett
BasicDescription.Synopsis: From township jive to tuva throatsinging, Charlie Gillett unearths wonderfully stimulating sounds from around the globe in this selection of World Music tracks.

BasicDescription.Title: Health Matters
BasicDescription.Synopsis: In her continuing look at health and the well-being over the seven ages of humankind, Connie St Louis turns her attentions to the adult years of 20-24.

BasicDescription.Title: Everywoman
BasicDescription.Synopsis: A weekly magazine programme for and about women around the world.

BasicDescription.Title: Newshour
BasicDescription.Synopsis: News, comment and analysis from around the world. Newshour brings you the latest live reports on events all over the globe.

BasicDescription.Title: World Business Report
BasicDescription.Synopsis: Analysis of the key business issues of the day, with up-to-date information on key currency rates, commodity prices and stock market indices.

BasicDescription.Title: British News
BasicDescription.Synopsis: The latest news and comment from Britain.

BasicDescription.Title: Sports Roundup
BasicDescription.Synopsis: Sports Roundup brings you sports news, stories and results from all around the world. The team of global correspondents collect stories, scores and interviews.

BasicDescription.Title: Off The Shelf
BasicDescription.Synopsis: Discovering Home: By Binyavanga Wainaina from Kenya, who is the winner of this year's Caine Prize for African Writing. Broadcast in two parts.

BasicDescription.Title: The World Today
BasicDescription.Synopsis: News and analysis from around the world.
